properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:56AM EST until February 13 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Lake effect snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 7 inches with the greatest accumulation
over higher terrain from Negaunee through the Michigamme
Highlands. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will result in
extensive blowing snow.

* WHERE...Marquette County.

* WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to noon EST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...An Arctic front moving through the region will sharply
reduce visibility to near zero at times in snow and blowing
snow this afternoon, and the hazardous conditions will continue
into the Thursday morning commute. Roads will also become
slippery. Wind chills will drop as low as 20 below zero late
tonight into Thursday morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel this afternoon and evening, pack a winter
survival kit and be prepared to slow down as sharp visibility
reductions in snow and blowing snow are expected.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON EST THURSDAY
